body.description: Embrace a whole Wi-Fi coverage in your home and office with the intelligent Synology Mesh Router MR2200ac. Designed with Tri-Band and MU-MIMO technology, MR2200ac makes sure your devices are on the fastest bandwidth dedicated to an optimized performance while keeping multiple devices reliably connected without any delay. Besides, you can enjoy the best Wi-Fi seamless roaming with a single Wi-Fi name among your modular mesh system. Safe Access provides easy-to-use parental management while keeping away any malicious intrusions. Synology MR2200ac is backed by Synology. Compatible with: Client support for WPA3 is required for compatibility.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: The Next Generation of Mesh Wi-Fi Powerful Wi-Fi performance and range:Tri-band 2.13 Gbps (400+867+867 Mbps) bandwidth optimized for performance and reliability.Intuitive setup, management, connectivity:Easy setup and remote management from web client or mobile app.Professional-level controls, brought to the home:Comprehensive parental management and easy-to-use interface with Safe Access.

Product Features Get Coverage for the Entire Home or Office Extend an existing RT2600ac Wi-Fi network with an additional MR2200ac unit, or build a complete mesh system with multiple MR2200ac routers. Wherever you go, stay on a single Wi-Fi network and enjoy seamless connectivity from one place to another. With its Tri-band technology featuring MU-MIMO support, MR2200ac allows connected devices to achieve maximum Wi-Fi speeds and reduces congestion. Redefine Parental Control Safe Access allows you to easily understand the Internet habits of children at different ages and help protect them from online dangers. Set rules based on the user instead of device with User Profiles. Internet schedules and Time Quota help you encourage children to use time wisely. You can also set up additional whitelists or blacklists so children can only visit or are blocked from specific sites. Setup and Maintain Your Network From Anywhere Whether you’re doing it from a smartphone or computer, setting up your MR2200ac and getting your Internet up and running takes just a couple of minutes. Easily manage your network remotely, from any device, with the free QuickConnect and DDNS services.

State-of-the-Art Security Synology Mesh Router MR2200ac offers DNS/IP threat intelligence to protect everything in the network from malicious websites. Certified by the newest Wi-Fi security standards including WPA3-Personal, WPA3-Enterprise and OWE, MR2200ac equips home, business, and open Wi-Fi networks with better defenses against snooping and other attacks. Advanced VPN capabilities With the VPN Plus Server add-on package, you can transform your MR2200ac into a powerful yet intuitive VPN solution. VPN Plus Server provides security and convenience to your remote workforce when you need remote access to internal network resources. Comprehensive Network Management Traffic control keeps you updated in real-time with detailed information of each application and device, while also allowing you to define the bandwidth of services with application QoS and the bandwidth allocation of devices. Thanks to the generated Network Traffic Report, you can easily track the detailed event logs and recent traffic trends. File Sharing, Management and Backup Comprehensive sharing capabilities combined with Cloud Station Server allow you to create your personal cloud storage with ease. Easily backup, share, and sync your files with your MR2200ac from multiple devices. With the Media Server package, your MR2200ac can serve as a media server to any smart television set, set-top-box, or gaming consoles.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great HW/SW - Easy to use, fast, and satisfactory for complex home networks; i.e., BSD users
reviews.reviewText: The MR2000AC HW has a nice design with no pointy antennae, and has 4 cores. The setup/configuration process was fairly straightforward and is not so smart that you can actually have an advanced network downstream of the device. The LAN and WAN ports are clearly marked and usable - no forced magic in trying to determine the router interface, though it can do that. Initially during setup the MR2000AC unit wants to be "the router" and communicate directly with the modem, but this step can be skipped. Ultimately, I want the pair (I bought two of the same for a mesh) to be just an AP (access point) - I already have a openbsd firewall gateway for my network. I was able to setup the wifi address range and carve out the high end of class C for DHCP, using the same class C ip range as my old netgear unit, but only allowing the synology the high end of the IP range - made for an easy migration. I was also able to connect/direct the synology wifi MR2000AC to talk to my local router, and then it all just started working! It took less than an hour to setup and adding the sub unit was a snap. Confusingly, I had difficulty with the manual in setting up the sub AP - that extends the mesh - I could not find the area in the manual to do it. But, after walking through the software - it looks like a virtual desktop in a web browser - I was quickly able to connect the 2nd MR2000AC via the "Wi-Fi Connect" applet. It's so cool that the MR2000AC uses a 5GHz back channel to talk to the main unit; that's how mesh works I guess . The software has a nice javascript overlay box with the status on each of the MR2000AC units, and you can observe and inspect bandwidth, mac, and frequency of each device connected. I notice it has support for SNMP, SMB, and can likely act as a sort of low redundancy NAS. I 'saw' the SMB endpoint on the network in my roku or firestick when trying to scan for screen mirroring. The software is extensive, and easy to use. I was able to upgrade the firmware easily and it's smart about it - staging the download before you install. A very polished product. It's only been a week, but I love the HW/SW. Our old netgear was getting crushed physically by the covid19 zooming, etc, and migrating to the MR2000AC pair resolved streaming problems. I placed the mesh units physically separate as to enable the 1300 sqft as best as possibly with minimal effort. The entire house is now covered, onto the deck, and into the backyard, and upstairs as well in the furthest room - still has sufficient connectivity. I put the MR2000AC synologyrouter in the basement connected to the gigabit switch, and the 2nd MR2000AC is on the first floor on the other side of the house - say 20 ft from the synologyrouter. It seems like clients reconnect to the other units with no disconnections. It's awesome.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to setup, great performance.
reviews.reviewText: A lot of these WiFi mesh products are a nightmare (such as the Google one) but this thing just works and sets up very nicely with other twins to create a seemless mesh system that just simply works and gives you a rich set of features to fill whatever your WiFi needs are.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great mesh add-on for Synology RT2600ac
reviews.reviewText: For our 4,000 sq ft home we deployed 3 of these MR2200ac units to create a mesh network driven by a RT2600ac base station. Setup was very easy with the Synology DS Router mobile app and the resulting network has been super-fast -- 3x faster with one-third the latency of the eero 6 mesh network that we replaced. Bear in mind however that these units are not wall-mountable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Feature-rich, solidly built, fast WIFI router.
reviews.reviewText: The purchase was intended for, primarily, parental control, and, secondarily, reduce my wifi latency which was around 100ms loaded. Parental controls on this device are excellent, highly configurable and work fine. They implemented virtually every common parental control feature, and I think did a great job at that. And, as a bonus, my WiFi latency now is between 30-40ms, which translates into faster loading sites and less breaks during zoom calls.The device seems excellently built and software is superior, highly configurable and with lots of options and services. I'd say it's at least semi-professional grade. The only downside is that too many configuration options may possibly confuse inexperienced users who don't want to delve too much into intricacies of local wifi network architecture. They might prefer a simpler model than this one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great mesh router. Easy setup for Synology stuff.
reviews.reviewText: I am replacing a 10 year old Apple Time Capsule. This was an expensive & high end product at the time. Wi-Fi dual band & a 2 TB auto back up in one product. But I couldn’t get close to Spectrum’s advertised 300 mb/sec download speed. I was getting 20+. Spectrum tech out. System was ok, but he suggested the old chips and Apple tech of 10 years ago can’t handle this much bandwidth. No Apple no longer produces the “Time Capsule”.I replaced it with all Synology stuff. Main router, this mesh router to extend range, and a Synology backup drive with 2 - 2 TB drives. System works like a charm. Spectrum tech was right. My slow download speeds were the result of NOT upgrading my old Apple Time Capsule. YES, it was slick having everything in one device, but now gettin consistent 300 mb/sec speeds and I’m happy.

I was going to buy something like a « Fing box » or a « Circle » AND a new router. But did not like the idea of « ARP » spoofing my own network.This mesh router does it all and then some... parental controls are advanced enough I can set and forget. My wife loves the « rewards » and « pause » buttons in safe access. Companion app is simple and accessible. And still very « powerful ».I’m not using the « mesh » as I only bought one unit. Wifi signal strength is very good for my condo, and the router does a great job of choosing which band (2.4 or 5.0) to use for clients. Already has WPA3 encryption...Over the month I’ve been using this, I have just scratched the surface of what this thing can do. But I would recommend for sure for home use. Maybe even some light business use.The hardware does lack horsepower though when using advanced features like threat prevention and « quality of service » functions. For those, more demanding features, I wish I had bought the RT2600AC instead, but it is not available in Canada.
So simple to install a setup as a mesh system. Great wifi coverage throughout my entire home. Synology makes excellent products !
Bon appareil mais difficile à configurer pour exploiter au mieux ses capacités

Good product as usual, works properly. make sure you update it because all the new interesting package are missing without updating it. download atation workd perfectly. only bemol is there is only one ethernet port for your client. would be great to have at least 3 other or invest in a small switch. Easy to setup if you have at least a little bit of brain. easy to backup and restore.
Incorrect information in your production description.:you mention 4 ports,which is wrong-it has 2 ports,1 Wan and 1 Lan...MR2200ac
